website_summaries.verdict: Marrying a clock radio with a digital photo frame is an awesome concept, but the Philips AJL308 needs to be improved upon before it becomes the perfect union.
pros: The Philips AJL308 is both a clock radio and a digital photo frame, and it's got a fairly sleek look to it
It plays back MP3 and WMA audio files, as well as MPEG4 and DivX video files from thumbdrives and SD/MMC memory cards
Some users may appreciate the included novelty alarms and "relaxation" sleep modes
cons: The image is low resolution, the sound is tinny, some of the user controls aren't as intuitive as they should be, images load slowly, and not all MPEG4 files are recognized

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful alarm clock for displaying memorabilia but not easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Love this clock radio but it isn’t real easy to set time. In fact they quit making it because I tried to purchase another one. I’ve had mine since around 2010, purchased for my mom to look at memorabilia.
customer_reviews.author: PattieCakes

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I love this thing. However, if you don't set the backlight to shut off at the right time then you will not be sleeping like you want to. It would be great if I could get this thing to wake me up to my favorite tunes like I thought it would have. All in all, this thing is an alarm clock with an enormous display compared to others that is very bright and colorful. It doubles as a picture frame/mp3 player. I do rather enjoy the variety of alarm noises. If you love gadgets and are looking to get rid of your crappy old clock/radio this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: DarthErika

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget....
customer_reviews.text: I waited until it went on sale at Amazon for $50. I didn't think it's worth more than that. Usual price is $129 at circuitcity, $79-99 at Amazon. Two things I didn't particularly like about it is that you cannot chose the picture when it is on clock mode (you can only view the first pic on your USB drive), and it does not have a battery back-up. Other than that, for $50, it has all the features I needed (alarm, clock, radio, picture frame), and I read you can play movies with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Willie C.

customer_reviews.title: Keep breaking
customer_reviews.text: I really love this radio but this is the 3rd one I bought and it keeps breaking. The radio will just not go on and the screen shuts off. This is my 3rd one and it finally is working ok but prob not for long. But as far the shipper it came in brand new conditions, and was shipped fast. Lets hope it keeps working because this is a really cool radio.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Fetko

customer_reviews.title: Great function for the price, mediocre screen quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a learning tool for my toddler with the intent of putting flash cards on the screen. There is lots of good functionality (USB, SD card reader, MP3 player) but some simple programming would fix glitches such as not displaying a picture at the proper size. I would not pay more than $50 for this item as the screen quality is mediocre and there is now better technology available.
customer_reviews.author: Backscheider

customer_reviews.title: Brightness problem fixed in newer versions
customer_reviews.text: Now they have a feature - Auto Dim) that will turn off the display at a specified time... You can always hit the snooze control (Repeat Alarm/Brightness Control) button to see the time in the middle of the night, but otherwise it's completely dark. (It's called the Auto Dim Timer so it can auto dim from 10pm to 6am or whatever you like) I purchsed it for my desk, and not the bedroom, so the brightness issue wasn't a show-stopper for me... But then I discovered they fixed it and I didn't see that reported in the various review.
customer_reviews.author: KarlZ

customer_reviews.title: Good while it works...
customer_reviews.text: Great product while It worked. I bought this in 2007 and I came Into work today to find the device just at a black screen. The thing is shot, it just won't turn on anymore. I did some basic troubleshooting and of course it's out of warrenty so there is nothing I can do. So enjoy this while it works but seems to me that the power supply inside burnt out or something
customer_reviews.author: Freeze

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty old piece of tech. It's great for what it is, especially at the time it came out. Now, it would be a little bit outdated; the interface is kinda clunky and it doesn't display any kind of image, etc. I would but something more modern.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro A. Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: Won't wake you up with MP3 !!!
customer_reviews.text: When you spend a bit of money on such a piece of equipment that is capable of great functionalities such as mp3 and (the most common forms of) videos (divx for example) playback in an alarm clock, you would think that the conceptors would have spend the tiniest bit of there intelligence to link it all together allowing you to at least start a shuffled playlist of mp3s (or, even better videos). Well, think again it wont ! Other than that it's such a cool device. (It's just ultra frustrating to not have that mp3 wakeup ability)
customer_reviews.author: Francois M. Dermu

customer_reviews.title: Philips Clock Radio
customer_reviews.text: Peodect was recieved way before the estimated time of arrival. It works just fine and the description said it was used. I guess I was expecting original parts and it seems that the power supply was replaced. This didn't effect how it worked, just took me by surprise.
customer_reviews.author: I. Cristo

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months Later Alarm Clock DEAD
customer_reviews.text: This alarm clock was great while it was working. You could place photos on it and it looked real nice on our mantle. When one day it decided to shut off and never comeback on. Not only were we late for work the warranty was up on the product by like 8 days. The Screen was bright and beautiful the time would lose minutes every now and then. Like if we set it at 11:41 exactly with our phones, two weeks later we would look at our phones and it would be 11:41 and the alarm clock would say like 11:38. Waste of cash!!!
customer_reviews.author: BMOSS

customer_reviews.title: A decent value, but could be a lot better
customer_reviews.text: The Good: All in one device with a compact form factor. Good option if you are looking to replace an old alarm clock as we were. The Bad: Requires a storage card for best and most cosmetic operation. Screen emits a fair amount of light even with the dimmest mode --- my wife had to turn it the other way in order to fall asleep. The Ugly: Low resolution screen and photos are slow to load. No slide show function in clock mode.
customer_reviews.author: S Reddy

customer_reviews.title: Near perfection !
customer_reviews.text: This is just a great item for the office. You could watch your photos randomly, videos and hear your mp3 or radio. The only thing is that it doesn't have an ear plug and that while in clock mode the pictures won't change. I will definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold J. Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Great clock radio and digital picture frame
customer_reviews.text: This item is great! I bought it for my wife as a Christmas present and it has worked wonderfully. We haven't had any problems. The pictures look great on the screen and the clock is nice and big too. It would be nice to have the slide show in clock mode too, but it still deserves 5 stars without that option, sspecially for the price compared to other digital frames and what they offer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: this is not your typical alarm clock! beautiful screen on which you can download pictures to display along with time, date, and alarm status. highly recommend this product. great gift for the person who has everything.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen L. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-use device
customer_reviews.text: Great multi-use device, including large time display, photos, and SD card slot for pix and music. Major downer for me is lack of AM radio
customer_reviews.author: jrc

customer_reviews.title: WOW, this frame/calender/radio does it all very well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when amazon had it listed for $50... I feel like i stole this! Its a great all around frame and desktop tool. I'd pay up to $100 for it, but i'm considered "cheap". Other places have it listed for $180

customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase its a combination between a good desktop alarm clock, and a digital picture frame. Its easy to use, bright with auto Dim function, resolution could be nbetter and screen size could be bigger but its more than acceptable as it is. Not to forget the excellent digital ratio and its reception.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just recived couple of days...Didnt had much time to play with it. Just checked the sound its very good and display is nice tooo. For the price i paid was an steal....40 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy257

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find but worth the search
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this clock on a Best Buy display over their clock radios. But they don't even stock this radio! This is a good alarm clock with lots of extra features. I like the big numbers, the brightness controls, and the personalized photos features. It doesn't seem to have a slide show feature for your pictures when you are in "clock" mode. But that's minor.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cabral

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mom for a birthday present. I am so glad I did. This was a much better deal than a plain digital picture frame. She really enjoys the radio on it.
customer_reviews.author: Neroyer

customer_reviews.title: No mp3 alarm function
customer_reviews.text: Definately look at the other reviews. I am considereing sending this product back. One of the reasons I bought it was because the description said you can awaken to your own music. That is wrong you can only choose the radio or a few other sounds like a buzzer, rooster, waves, etc that are already on the clock. You can not choose your own music for the alarm!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Paden

customer_reviews.title: Not a recommended item
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about other similar products, how long they run, but it didn't even ran for 2 years. I was just using as clock with one customized photo thats it. But one fine day it just stopped display and no sound (dead). I was expecting this to ran for few more years atleast. May be for the money I paid it may be worth (which was in deal), but if someone is paying in full it is not worth.
customer_reviews.author: Bala B. Kammari

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best product I ever purchased for an extremely very good price of $60 -- Thank you very much
customer_reviews.author: rsat

customer_reviews.title: review 09/25/12
customer_reviews.text: Shipment was done without issue and in the time frame requested. The product is not as expected on our side. Reading a lot of review and comments, i dod not quite lived up to my expectation.

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Hello everyone, This product is cool, and became my life easier..good design, good picture resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!!! WILL STOP WORKING AFTER A FEW MONTHS, REVIEWS DON'T LIE
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE!!! STOP WORKING AFTER ABOUT 6 MONTHS!! WASTE OF MONEY, DON'T BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: IndustryMvp

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: A good deal for $50 when Amazon had it, don't buy it for more than 70 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Haas

customer_reviews.title: The pre-loaded generic picture (same in the product description) sucks, so make sure you have your own pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you read the instructions on which SD cards work on this. I decided to use a thumbdrive instead of an SD card. The pre-loaded generic picture (same in the product description) sucks, so make sure you have your own pictures loaded. If not, you will have to look at the generic picture all day. I'm glad that it has a radio. I get to look at my pictures and listen to the radio while at work.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernPlayers

customer_reviews.title: You can sell your bedroom lamps!
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea for a clock design but it has it's flaws. It has 4 brightness settings and a program to auto-dim during the times you program. The most noticeable flaw and the reason we returned ours was that the very dimmest brightness setting still lights the bedroom brighter than any night light could. The entire 7" screen emits light far greater than the typical LCD display. It is obnoxious how bright it keeps the bedroom. Hopefully enough people will complain so that Philips makes a software update to allow the screen to be dimmed further or turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until screen started going bad after about 3 years. Sad cause I like the design.
customer_reviews.author: OneHungLow

customer_reviews.title: More than just a picture frame - nice desktop gadget
customer_reviews.text: The Philips AJL308 is more than just a picture frame - it's a nice and useful desktop gadget as well. Image quality is good, although a higher resolution screen would be desirable. But then, at the price I paid for it, $ 89.99, it's about what one should expect. The only critique I have is the user interface. There are far too many buttons and mutations how to use them. It is hard to understand why Philips did not take advantage of the graphic display and use a context-driven/graphics-guided user interface. The additional hardware cost would have been zero. With that, I would have given the product a full five stars (reflecting the attractive price).
customer_reviews.author: HPB

customer_reviews.title: 2 adapters in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital frame which I have had now for over 2 years. Biggest problem with it... Power adapters burn out. I've bought 2 adapters... $30.00 each at radio shack. The radio is only FM no AM! Save your money and put it towards a different digital frame.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for 1 major flaw...
customer_reviews.text: Great looking product that is very easy to use. Would be 5 stars except for 1 major flaw... When setting the date, the day display in not correct. For example, if you set the date to Sep. 10, 2007, it will display Sunday instead of Monday. Have had the same issue with 2 models now, and in store model had the same issue. Other minor issues is that you must have a USB or SD card inserted (not included) to change the default photo the clock comes with. Not a big deal except that the USB port is on the side of the unit, so you will have an ugly USB sticking out of the clock.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Had this clock for years. The alarm function is mighty shady, apart from the fact that the alarm on/off buttons are flush with the snooze button, making it easy for snoozers to turn off their alarm. Additionally, the radio button is easy to hit, causing it to come on with a loud (louder than the alarm??) burst of FM static at whatever hour late at night you're messing with this stupid device. This clock has made me late for/miss one too many things. Time for Mr. Clock to meet Mr. Hammer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ruby

customer_reviews.title: No other alarm clock like it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a unique alarm clock to perform the basic functions that an alarm clock could and stumbled upon this. Yes, as stated in previous reviews, there are certain key aspects to it that can be improved but if your looking for an alarm clock with a large screen, cool features and that looks great in the bedroom, this is it. As soon as you use it you'll agree its a great gift idea. Granted the picture quality isn't great but its alarm clock, what do you expect? For its basic functionality, aesthetics and good features I rate this a 4 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Moskowitz

customer_reviews.title: I love it...
customer_reviews.text: I love this gadget - and let's be honest, at the end of the day it's an expensive alarm clock, with some features that move it into the gadget arena. I doubt I would have bought a digital photo frame for it's own sake, but this had instant appeal. It does look fantastic, and it does what alarm clocks should do...with a load of style. I agree with some of the ealier niggles - the inability to select your own wake up music being the biggest downer for me. But I've had mine for two months now, and I still get a kick out of looking at it ! Kind of makes waking up a pleasure !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ally G

customer_reviews.title: Good Alarm clock with some other features
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, it's mainly a good alarm clock with some other built in functionality. The quality of pictures is passable at best. So if you're looking for a digital picture frame, you're better off looking elsewhere. I haven't had a chance to test the video capabilities of this device, but other reviewers are of the opinion that it is nothing spectacular, as expected. The only bright spot is that Philips keeps working on firmware upgrades, so at least some functions should improve in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Anup

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use, slide show doesnt work, and it died 6 months later
customer_reviews.text: Well, my title says it all. The buttons are not clear as to which to push to get which action. I put a memory card in to use as a picture slide show and it just sits on the first one. then about 6 months after purchase, it just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: J. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: How PHILIPS can sell this????
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to use it! - The backlight is so strong that I couldn't use it in the bedroom. - There's no battery, so the clock resets after a power failure, making it unreliable. Unfortunately I'm still using my old alarm clock and I don't know what to do with this product! It really was a BAD purchase... And there are some details that make the product even worse: it plays mp3 files, but you can't use them as the alarm sound! Who projected this device????
customer_reviews.author: Wilson F. Martins

customer_reviews.title: Philips Digital Frame/Clock Radio
customer_reviews.text: Good product, nice to see that it can play Divx videos. Can do mp3s, jpgs, and divx vids straight from your san-disk! All amazing stuff for a cheap price but not much flexibility otherwise. Thin choice of alarms, annoying time clock and auto-dimmer when playing vids, jpg randomizer hard to use, mp3 player is feature-less. Still glad to have gotten it for my niece though. enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Oshiro

customer_reviews.title: No Waking up to your MP3s
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could wake up to my own music on an SD card. The information is carefully worded to be vague about it. I did not see any way to set the alarm to the SD card and contacted Philips who said you can only view pictures and listen to mp3 in sleep mode or just on, no alarm setting. I was surprised and disappointed they went so far with a great design and then dropped the ball on something so simple.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Compton

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband for Father's Day. He wanted a digital radio and also a digital picture frame for his office. The kids took pictures of themselves and we had everything loaded for when we gave him the gift. It was great. It doesn't take up alot of space and can fit neally anywhere. The reception is great even when other radios didn't. Perfect for the office.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Lush

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviews this item is Great out of the box. Image quality is good, sound quality is good. However biggest downside, no battery backup. So if you want to use it as your only alarm clock you better hope your power doesn't go out. When power did come back on it always reset the time to something way off.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fittro

customer_reviews.title: Great all round clock with an added functionality of a digital photo frame!
customer_reviews.text: This clock is really good.has dual alarm modes.screen brightness can be controlled and set as per user's convinience...it plays mp3 files and DivX video files(*.avi)also slide shows your images from a usb drive or an sd card with great transition effects,it has a good fm radio player and decent speaker output...screen is nice and overall build quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Sunny Thukral

customer_reviews.title: Philips Clock/Radio/Digital Frame
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful. It has mulitpule features and works great . It has an alarm clock, radio, digital frame, mp3 player.I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Krystalbel Riedel

customer_reviews.title: It could be so much more....
customer_reviews.text: Its like a blackjack compared to an iPhone, its cools but just shockingly bad software. Why don't they just let the software be open source and we could download our own on to it. Its professional design, great idea, but fails on execution - see the other comments for details. For those of us that have bought it, we should all email Philips and demand a software upgrade (note if you go to their product support website, there is an upgrade for an old bug, but not a general upgrade for deficiencies in design).
customer_reviews.author: M. Clemens

customer_reviews.title: discounted price make this unit more likeable
customer_reviews.text: never reviewed anything. this is more like a find. just got the unit today at BJ for 79.99. photo quality is pretty rough but not unclear. playing some japanese cartoon in divx file as I am typing this review and it looks more than acceptable. i think i will keep this unit. Besides, SD card is so cheap these days i dont mind getting one just to display my kids pictures.

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Walmart for $49. Total piece of junk. Followed directions and the software would not respond. Returning tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hagerty

customer_reviews.title: 3 thumb tacks work better
customer_reviews.text: 3 thumb tacks, 3 photo's and a wall is easier. Read carefully...with memory so cheap, the construction of the screen must be really expensive. This electronic frame can only hold 3 photo's at best, otherwise a dedicated photo chip or memory stick is required, more cost. Also this electronic frame when connected to Mac OS10.04 was not recognized and could not load pictures directly to frame, only by memory stick and a limit of three pics. customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: By going thru Amzon.com I paid a little more than half of what I would have paid buying the item brand new. It was a brand new item that someone else had purchased but did not want which worked out great for me. The purchase, payment and receipt of the item was very easy and fast. I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: S. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: For Idiots Only
customer_reviews.text: This product has so many flaws that it is absolutely perfect for the numb-nuts idiots who wrote these reviews and spent over one hundred fifty dollars for a high-tech looking device to replace the ubquitous twenty dollar bedside clock radio. Hope the super bright LCD screen keeps them up all night wondering why.
customer_reviews.author: Brus Laguna

customer_reviews.title: Nice little clock
customer_reviews.text: I like this item and got a great deal on it which makes it even better. I think the screen is big and it has a lot of decent features.
customer_reviews.author: Frequency

customer_reviews.title: One Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: It is a great idea, but has one fatal flaw: when displaying the clock, it cannot show a slide show for the picture by the clock. You can use it for a slideshow frame, you can use it for an alarm clock, but you cannot use it for an alarm clock with a slideshow. I returned it as a result of this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul of California

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Got exactly what I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: The product was awesome. I got it as a gift for my boyfriend. He is a super nerd. He loved it. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryane L. Hartung

customer_reviews.title: I like mine.
customer_reviews.text: A little cropping (top/bottom) on landscape photos. Not sure if you can operate in slideshow mode while clock is displayed - but I keep mine in slideshow mode and photos cycle every 5 seconds (default).
customer_reviews.author: Steven K. Stearns

customer_reviews.title: great clock/radio
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this item and wow, great clock and so easy to use. Love the features such as USB and Sd card slot. Highly recommended to all.
customer_reviews.author: Rizaldy F. Villorente

product_meta.title: Philips USA AJL308 Clock Radio with 7-Inch TFT LCD Color Display and USB/SD Card Slot (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Start the day right with the Philips AJL308 Clock Radio, where you can wake up to the 7-inch color showing off your favorite photo, song, or video. In addition to clock, radio and calendar functions, you can even use pre-loaded relaxation music that will help you fall asleep. Built-in USB and SD card slots let you store all of your photos, music and video clips. You can enjoy music or radio channels with FM digital auto tuning and presets. Set dual alarm times and wake up gently with the increasing alarm volume.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer 

WAKE UP TO YOUR FAVORITE MUSIC, PHOTOS AND VIDEO
Offering the ultimate in flexibility, the Philips AJL308 Clock Radio awakens you to your choice of nature sounds, radio, your own music or a traditional alarm buzzer. You can also display your favorite photo as the background image on the 7-inch color LCD screen, watch photo slideshows set to music and view video clips. Start your day off right by waking up to a treasured photo, your favorite tune or the sounds of nature. It's perfect for the bedside, but also fits attractively on your office desk. No matter what your alarm clock needs, the Philips AJL308 Clock Radio has it all. 






Wake to your own music, radio, an alarm buzzer or even sounds from nature START THE DAY YOUR WAY
Wake Up How You Want 

Start your day right by waking up how you want. The Philips AJL308 Clock Radio lets you choose your wake up call. 

Hate being jolted awake? Normal alarm sounds with a preset volume are either too low to wake you up or are so uncomfortably loud that you are awakened abruptly. The Gentle Wake feature starts with a subtle, low alarm that gradually increases to a reasonably high level in order to gently rouse you from sleep. You can use the Gentle Wake feature with your own music, FM radio or the buzzer alarm and make rude awakenings a thing of the past. 

Do you prefer to wake up to music or news? Digital FM radio offers you additional audio options with the ability to store up to 20 different radio stations. Simply tune into the station that you want to preset and press and hold the preset button--that's all it takes. You can quickly access your favorite radio station without having to manually tune in each time. 

The AJL308 comes with an SD/MMC memory card slot so you can play your own music through the clock radio speakers. All you need to do to play MP3 or WAV files is insert an SD/MMC card with your music on it into the slot on the AJL308. The Music menu appears and you're off and running. 

Dual Alarm Time 

The AJL308 has two alarm settings available. Set one alarm time to wake you up and the other to wake up your partner. 

Pre-loaded Relaxation Music Lets You Fall Asleep Peacefully 

Relax or fall asleep to peaceful sounds. The AJL308 is pre-loaded with a number of relaxation music pieces. Choose from rain showers, ocean waves, spa music and more, and enjoy in relaxed comfort. 
Easily read date, time and radio information 
and view photos and video 

7-inch Display for Time, Date and Radio Info Viewing 

The Philips AJL308 Clock Radio has a large 7-inch viewing area to enable easy readability of the content on the screen, even from a distance. It is ideal for the elderly or the visually restricted. You can also display your favorite photo as the background image. 

Wake Up to Photos of Your Loved Ones 

The AJL308 comes with an easy-to-use feature that allows you to display your favorite photo as the clock’s background image. When you wake up in the morning, you see not only the time, but the photo of your family, friends, pets, vacation memories--whatever you want--by your bedside. It's a nice way to start a new day. 

Enjoy Digital Music or Broadcast Radio While Viewing Photos 

Enjoy viewing your photos while listening to your favorite digital music or FM radio station. Simply select "Photo with music" from the menu, then sit back and enjoy them both at the same time. The AJL308 comes with USB and SD/MMC memory card slots so you can play your favorite MP3 and WMA music files through the clock radio and view your favorite digital images on the LCD at the same time. 

View Special Photos in Slideshows by Your Bedside 

Store your favorite photos on an SD/MMC card and play them in slideshows on your AJL308 Clock Radio. Thanks to complete file transferability, you can easily enjoy the convenience and fun of showing digital photos or video clips via the SD/MMC card slot. Just insert your memory card into the appropriate slot on your clock radio, set the display options (sequence, effects and transitions) and view your own personal slideshow on your clock radio’s screen. Now you can relive your favorite moments with family and friends any time you want. 

Deep Stereo Sound 

Equipped with a Bass Reflex Speaker System, the AJL308 delivers a deep bass experience from a compact loudspeaker box system for an enhanced listening experience that blows away the average clock radio.
